intro: Exacum ovale, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, showy flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers bloom in terminal inflorescences. Exacum ovale is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
